page.title: 15MARYC.RELIGION CHURCHES
page.content: Maryculter Church is the parish Church of Scotland. The present building dates from 1787 and contains interesting old box pews and a fine glass picture. The Church was enlarged in 1882 by an organ transept. A hall and kitchen facilities were added in 1963.It is linked with Banchory- Devenick and Cookney. There are between 270-310 members. In addition to the Sunday services a Bible Study is held mid-week and a group called Quest has recently been started by Rev. David Simpson for teenagers. There are 71 Roman Catholics in the area who meet in the Chapel of nearby Blairs College. A member of the College Staff acts as part-time priest. The Steiner foundation at Camphill is Theosophist.
